info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 4:50PM EDT until July 30 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Letcher and Perry.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Letcher, Blackey, Hallie, Banks, Bluefield, Lilley Cornett Woods, Red Star, Ulvah, Elko, Skyline, Roxana, Daisy, Indian Bottom, David, Slemp, Carbon Glow, Premium, Hot Spot and Jeremiah.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING
